text: Just an option similar to require_js would be awesome.
this is a simple question, ¿how you make a gallery on a blog post on the HubSpot editor?

sounds like a tough challenge(not breaking existing sites) maybe make it a toggle feature "call jQuery in the head" and default it to false for all new sites. For old sites it will be true. Then individual developers can toggle it off.

There are a few ways, easiest way is to add the gallery module to blog detail template. note if you do this you will want to have a way to toggle it off/hide it because otherwise it will be empty in any posts without gallery content
yup. We would like to not put the burden of testing every site on developers, so we’re looking at ways to verify that jQuery isn’t called in the body.
That'd certainly be awesome if you manage to do that. Sounds difficult to do reliably though.
